intro: Neocryptodiscus persicus, commonly known as the Persian cryptodiscus, is a rare and unique plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in botany and conservation biology. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
